question.Title: How do I fix my conditional statement for marks input in Python?
question.Body:
I have recently started learning python and we were asked to work on conditional statements.

I have tried to use if,elif and else functions. I put the code on python IDLE and then run it.

a=int(input("Enter the Math number"))b=int(input("Enter the Phy number"))c=int(input("Enter the Chem number"))Total=a+b+cprint=['Total']Average=Total/3print=['Average']if(Average>=90):print=('Excellent')elif(Average>=80 and Average>=90):print=('Very Good')elif(Average>=70 and Average>=80):print=('Good')elif(Average>=60 and Average>=70):print=('Ok')else:print('sorry try again')

When I try to run the code it only shows the input stages. It wont print the Total, Average, if,elif and else functions. Please help me find the mistake in my code. Thank you:)

answer.Body:
indentation is wrong . if statement should be well indented. 

a=int(input("Enter the Math number"))b=int(input("Enter the Phy number"))c=int(input("Enter the Chem number"))Total=a+b+cprint=(Total)Average=Total/3print=(Average)if(Average>=90):    print=('Excellent')elif(Average>=80 and Average>=90):    print=('Very Good')elif(Average>=70 and Average>=80):    print=('Good')elif(Average>=60 and Average>=70):    print=('Ok')else:    print('sorry try again')

when you want to print a variable don't use ' ', it become string instead of variable name

print is a function print() not an array so use it as a function.

You are assigning the print function to a list here:

print=['Average']

Change it to

print(Average)

Not related to the issue you are having, but your conditions don't make much sense, for example:

elif(Average>=80 and Average>=90):

which should probably be

elif(Average>=80 and Average<=90):

or

elif 90 >= Average >= 80:

You used the print method incorrectly.

You were assigning the values to a list called print not printing them!

The code below works. I also changed the second operand after the 'AND' operator, though this operation is redundant.

a=int(input("Enter the Math number: "))b=int(input("Enter the Phy number: ")) c=int(input("Enter the Chem number: ")) Total=a+b+c print('Total = ', Total)Average=Total/3 print('Average = ', Average)if(Average>=90):     print('Excellent') elif(Average>=80 and Average<90):            print('Very Good')elif(Average>=70 and Average<80):     print('Good') elif(Average>=60 and Average<70):     print('Ok')else:    print('sorry try again')
